class_notes: In a world and a lifestyle where we are constantly dramatically entertained from multiple screens and venues, it may be more important than ever to have the critical tools to analyze and evaluate dramatic writing. This course begins with the dramatic literature of Europe and the United States as a core sample from which to discern and evaluate plot, character, theme, structure, language, as well as the pleasures and communications of performance and visual and sonic design. Although it is a fundamental study for majors and minors in theater and playwriting, the course welcomes students of all backgrounds and disciplines.
course_description: The close reading of plays with a view to production. Exercises and projects explore how a text emerges in performance from the combined perspectives of actors, directors, designers, and audience.
